titleInfo.title: William Blount in Knoxville, Tennessee to Colonel David Henley

subject.topic: Frontier migration/experiments in representative democracy, encounters with Native Americans .
Anti-democracy impulses: Slavery, free people of color, and Removal of Native Americans .

mods.note: Blount tells Henley that James Kemp and three other Chickasaws should be boarded by Captain Chisholm until they can proceed on their trip to visit the President.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
